relevant_findings.Examination Findings: Posterior oropharynx erythematous, dry throat, and positive rapid streptococcus test.

vital_signs.Blood Pressure: 139 to 162 mm Hg systolic and 77 to 90 mm Hg diastolic

relevant_findings.Oral: Erythematous posterior oropharynx, moist mucous membranes, white plaque on tongue
relevant_findings.Abdomen: Soft, decreased bowel sounds, tenderness to deep palpation in epigastrium, slight guarding, no distention or rebound
relevant_findings.Skin: Flushed on cheeks, extremities, and trunk

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Tenderness in back developed, epigastric pain decreased slightly.

relevant_findings.Abdomen: Decreased bowel sounds, pain in upper quadrants radiating to back, mild tenderness on deep palpation; no distention or rebound

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal examination otherwise. No significant changes reported.

relevant_findings.Abdomen: Striae, decreased bowel sounds, palpable liver edge, mild tenderness to deep palpation in epigastrium, remainder normal
Upper abdominal tenderness, elevated serum amylase and lipase levels.
